result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marquese M Snow

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:02 PM Defendant Marquese M Snow in court.  Attorney Alex Hahn for Ashley Castro in court for Marquese M Snow.  Prosecuting attorney Theresa Fallon Villar in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
RCAP has filed a violation report on 8-31-22 in case 21CM793.
Deft went to test before court today and results came back negative.
State has some concerns with all the missed testing.
State is asking that bond be forfeited and a new bond set.
State now w/draws their request to forfeit bond due to new information.
BTC: Deft is admonished and warned, no action taken on bond today.
Defense is requesting another status date.
Deft needs to go back to the SPD's office so atty can be appointed on file 22CM883.
BTC: Matters adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:07 AM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marquese M Snow in court.  Attorney Ashley Castro in court for Marquese M Snow. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
21CM793 was scheduled for change of plea.
Deft has picked up a new file in case 22CM883.
Negotiations are on going.
Defense is requesting a status date.
BTC: Matter adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
